tilemap module

This module handles the creation, management, and rendering of tilemaps for the game. It provides functionalities for loading and saving tilemaps from files, accessing and modifying the tiles

within the map, and rendering the

tilemap to the screen. It also includes utilities for tile-based collision detection and automatic tile variant selection based on neighboring tiles to create more visually cohesive maps.

class tilemap.Tilemap(game, tile_size=16)[source]

Bases: object

Manages a grid of tiles for the game world, including loading, saving, rendering, and collision detection.

game

The main game object, providing access to global

Type:

Game

resources and settings.
tile_size

The size of each tile in pixels.

Type:

int

tilemap

A dictionary representing the grid of tiles, with

Type:

dict

keys as string coordinates "x;y".
offgrid_tiles

A list of tiles that do not align to the grid,

Type:

list

used for decorative elements.
extract(id_pairs, keep=False)[source]

Extracts tiles from the map matching specific id and variant pairs.

Parameters:

  • id_pairs (list of tuple) – A list of tuples (type, variant)

  • against. (to match tiles)

  • keep (bool, optional) – Whether to keep the matched tiles in the

  • False. (map. Defaults to)

Returns:

A list of matched tiles with their properties.

Return type:

list

load(path)[source]

Loads a tilemap from a file, replacing the current state.

Parameters: path (str): The file path to load the tilemap from.

physics_rects_around(pos)[source]

Gets a list of pygame.Rect objects for solid tiles around a specified position, for physics calculations.

Parameters:

pos (tuple) – The position to check around, in pixels.

Returns:

A list of pygame.Rect objects for solid tiles around the specified position.

Return type:

list

render(surf, offset=(0, 0))[source]

Renders the tilemap onto a given surface.

Parameters:

  • surf (pygame.Surface) – The surface to render the tilemap on.

  • offset (tuple) – An (x, y) offset to apply to the tile positions,

  • movement. (used for camera)

save(path)[source]

Saves the current state of the tilemap to a file.

Parameters:

path (str) – The file path to save the tilemap to.

solid_check(pos)[source]

Checks if a given position collides with a solid tile.

Parameters:

pos (tuple) – The position to check, in pixels.

Returns:

True if there is a collision with a solid tile, False

otherwise.

Return type:

bool

tiles_around(pos)[source]

Gets a list of tiles surrounding a specific position.

Parameters:

pos (tuple) – The position to check around, in pixels.

Returns:

A list of tiles around the specified position.

Return type:

list
